root.TEXT:
Record date: 2072-06-12
Internal Medicine Admit Note 06/12/72
Patient Name: Xavier Rutledge (KEKELA 53954143) Renal TPx Details: Cadaveric RTX 2060 w/ CAN and baseline Cr 2.5 Renal Dx: ESRD of unclear cause Current Immsp: CsA and Prednisone
Reason for Admit: Fever, diarrhea and probable UTI
Background: 63M with known CRRTx since 2060 with known CKD and baseline Cr 2.5 with urethral stricture and in-dwelling Foley catheter who presented to ED with h/o multiple episodes of diarrhea last night, cloudy urine and severe weakness. He was on Ampicillin for a recent UTI. He denies any fevers this past weekend, however he was febrile today at 102 F. He has chronic lower extremity edema for which he is on high dose lasix with minimal response. In ED patient was hypoglycemic with FSBS 46. He was givin 1amp D50 and a liter of NS IV.
Medical Hx: 1. ESRD s/p CRRTx 2060 - Prior to TPx was on HD via RUE AVF, presumed ESRD d/t HTN - CRRTx 2060 requiring re-implantation of the ureter two times - Renal Bx (2065): cyclosporine toxicity, nephrolithiasis, TIF - Baseline Cr 2.4 - 2.8, Renal Bx 2065: 2. Urethral stricture requiring repeated catherisation and c/b UTI's, foley in place. Plan for suprapubic catheter placement by Dr. Acevedo. - Multiple UTI's w/ h/o Candida (Apr 2072), Klebsiella (September 2071), Proteus 3. Type 2 DM - Diagnosed following TPx and steroids - On insulin 4. CMV retinitis post-transplant 5. Aortic stenosis - Echo 2071: AVA 1.3 cm and peak gradient 28 mmHg 6. Recurrent LE DVT's - on Coumadin 7. HTN 8. Torn right rotator cuff 9. Gout 10. BPH 11. Hypercholesterolemia 12. s/p left 5th toe amputation 13. h/o C. dif colitis 14. s/p ccy and appy 15. G6PD deficiency
Medications: Neoral 100mg bid po Prednisone 5/10mg qd po Lopressor 50mg bid po Lasix 80 mg bid po Iron Sulfate 325mg bid po Calcium Carbonate 500 mg tid po Flomax 0.8mg qhs po Proscar 5 mg qd po Coumadin 1 mg qd po Procrit 10,000 U q week (Wed) NPH 22 units qam and 10 U qpm, Insulin sliding scale qAC+HS Immodium q4-6hrs prn loose stools Ampicillin 500mg qid
Allergies: Codeine -> Nausea, Potassium -> Nausea and Rash, Quinine
Social History: Lives with wife, retired. Denies tobacoo (quit 30 yrs ago), ETOH9(quit 30 yrs ago), and ilicit drug use
Family History: unremarkable
On examination: General: Lying on bed in no distress Vitals: T99.8 F; BP 97/44 mmHg; HR 77/min; R 20 HEENT: (+) orbital edema b/l, (+) facial flushing CVS: S1 and S2, no S3/Rub, clinical ESM loudes over aortic areaResp: slight expiratory wheeze RLLB, no rhonchi or rales. Abd: Soft, non tender, no masses, NABS. Left sided palpable graft with no tenderness. Cloudy urine in Foley Legs: 3+ edema bilaterally RUE: AVF with thrill and bruit Neuro: A &O x 3

Date/Time ESR 06/12/2072 PEND 06/12/2072 20 (*)[32]
Radiology: 06/12/2072 12:16 KEKELA Radiology Report Status: Final Type: Chest PA & Lateral HISTORY: Fever.
Chest: Frontal and lateral views of the chest are compared to prior exam dated 5/31/2072 and show mild enlargement of the cardiac silhouette and an atherosclerotic aorta. There are small bilateral posterior pleural effusions. Adjacent parenchymal opacity may reflect atelectasis or early pneumonia in theappropriate clinical setting. Mild diffuse elevation of the interstitium appears chronic. Right upper lobe granuloma.
IMPRESSION: Mild cardiomegaly with small bilateral posterior pleural effusions. Adjacent parenchymal opacity could reflect subsegmental atelectasis or early pneumonia in the appropriate clinical setting. These findings were communicated by me to Dr. Ximena Webber at 2:25 p.m
A/P: 63M with known CRRTx since 2060 with known CKD and baseline Cr 2.5 with urethral stricture and in-dwelling Foley. Pt. now with fevers, UTI, and diarrhea. He will be admitted to George Rutledge, M.D. on the Internal Medicine.
1. Renal- CRRTx with creatinine elevated 3.1 (2.5), ? pyelonephritis - Urine cultures sent in the ED. - Would hold further iv fluids. - Continue current Lasix dose - Strict I/O - Check Urine Protein/Creat Ratio 2. Urologic- urethral stricture and in-dwelling foley cath with fever and high urinary WBC. - Given iv Levofloxacin/Ceftaz in the ED. - Need to change Foley cathether. - Dr Acevedo to review for suprapubic catheter placement. 3. Immunosuppresion - Continue CsA and Prednisone - Check CsA level in the am. 4. Pulm- 5. Endo- hypoglycemic in ED, will monitor closely with q AC + HS accuchecks. 6. GI- diarrhea - Will send stool for C-diff - Will check CMV viral load 7. Fluid Status- volume overloaded - Adequate on oral lasix
_____________________________________________ Arlene T. Whitaker,PA-C Internal Medicine beeper #11830
Patient seen and examined with renal fellow. I agree with the review of patient problems, history, medication, physical examination, assessment and plan as detailed in the fellow note above. Followup clinic visit arranged with patient. Case was discussed with patient, renal transplant nurse, and pharmacist.
George T. Rutledge, M.D.
